election_record.label: Massachusetts 1812 Electoral College, Southern District

overview.note: The Eastern Argus (Portland, ME) of October 29, 1812 lists the Republicans as "Whig Candidates".
William Rotch, Jr. is listed with 9993 votes in the Official Election Returns but the town totals add up to 9991.
David Scudder is listed with 9990 votes in the Official Election Returns but the town totals add up to 9989.
John Adams is listed with 5768 votes in the Official Election Returns but the town totals add up to 5772.
John Davis is listed with 5771 votes in the Official Election Returns but the town totals add up to 5766.
Joseph Barker is listed with 5767 votes in the Official Election Returns but the town totals add up to 5765.
Nathaniel Morton, Jr. is listed with 5593 votes in the Official Election Returns but the town totals add up to 5592.

sub_unit.name: Truro
sub_unit.note: The Town records of Truro list Nathaniel Morton with 21 votes.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston.

The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). November 17, 1812.
Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). November 21, 1812.
The Freeman's Journal and Philadelphia Mercantile Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). November 25, 1812.
